Package seng.monsters.model

Class GameManager

java.lang.Object
seng.monsters.model.GameManager
public class GameManager extends Object
The Game Manager that the model of the game

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameManager()
    Creates a bare-bone GameManager that still requires additional setup
    GameManager(int gold, int currentDay, int maxDays, int difficulty, String name)
    Creates a fully ready and functional GameManager that requires no additional setup

    • GameManager

      public GameManager(int gold, int currentDay, int maxDays, int difficulty, String name)
      Creates a fully ready and functional GameManager that requires no additional setup
      Parameters:
      gold - The starting amount of gold
      currentDay - The current day
      maxDays - The maximum amount of days
      difficulty - The difficulty scale
      name - The trainer name

    • hasNotEnoughMoneyForMonster

      public boolean hasNotEnoughMoneyForMonster()
      Check if the player has no monster and not enough funds to purchase a monster
      Returns:
      true if the player has no monster and gold is less than any monster price in the shop

    • hasNoPossibilityForRevive

      public boolean hasNoPossibilityForRevive()
      Check if the player has not active monster and not enough funds to purchase revive
      Returns:
      true if the player's party is all fainted and gold is less than the price of revive

    • hasNotBattleOnce

      public boolean hasNotBattleOnce()
      Check if the player has done a battle once
      Returns:
      true if any of enemies has fainted monster

      public boolean nextDay()
      Proceed to the following day and update all state accordingly
      Returns:
      A boolean signaling if the game is finished

      Trigger refreshes for any value that can be reloaded without changing the day

    • triggerNightEvents

      protected void triggerNightEvents()
      Triggers night events if game does not end after calling nextDay

    • changeEnvironment

      protected void changeEnvironment()
      Changes the environment to a randomly selected environment

    • partyMonstersLeave

      public Optional<Monster> partyMonstersLeave()
      Removes a monster from the party if their leave prerequisites are met. Only remove one monster at once to prevent indexing errors.
      Returns:
      the monster leaving the party, or null otherwise.

    • partyMonstersHeal

      protected void partyMonstersHeal()
      Heals each party monster by their heal rate if they are not fainted.

    • partyMonstersLevelUp

      public List<Monster> partyMonstersLevelUp()
      Levels up each monster in the party that meets level up prerequisites
      Returns:
      a list of any monsters that levelled up.

    • monsterJoinsParty

      public Optional<Monster> monsterJoinsParty()
      A chance that a random monsters join the party if there is a slot

      Joining chance: base = 0.01

      f(d, c, m) = base x d x c / m

      Returns:
      the monster that is joining the party, or null otherwise.

    • updateAvailableBattles

      protected void updateAvailableBattles()
      Update the available battles for the day

    • prepareBattle

      public BattleManager prepareBattle(BattleManager.UI ui, int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Prepare battle manager for a battle against selected enemy
      Parameters:
      ui - The UI used to the battle manager
      index - The index of the available battle
      Returns:
      The battle manager that had been prepared
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index given does not point to a valid enemy

    • useItemFromInventory

      public void useItemFromInventory(Item item, int monsterIndex) throws Item.NoEffectException, Inventory.ItemNotExistException, Trainer.MonsterDoesNotExistException
      Use a certain item in the inventory to a monster in the party
      Parameters:
      item - The item being used
      monsterIndex - The monster by their index
      Throws:
      Item.NoEffectException - If the item produces no changes
      Inventory.ItemNotExistException - If the item does not exist
      Trainer.MonsterDoesNotExistException - if the monster is null or doesn't exist

    • useItemFromInventory

      public void useItemFromInventory(Item item, Monster monster) throws Item.NoEffectException, Inventory.ItemNotExistException, Trainer.MonsterDoesNotExistException
      Use a certain item in the inventory to a monster in the party
      Parameters:
      item - The item being used
      monster - The monster itself
      Throws:
      Item.NoEffectException - If the item produces no changes
      Inventory.ItemNotExistException - If the item does not exist
      Trainer.MonsterDoesNotExistException - if the monster is null or doesn't exist

      Switch the monster by their index
      Parameters:
      from - Starting index
      to - Destination index
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If either the indices are not valid indices for the party

      Parameters:

      to - Destination index
      Throws:

      Buy a purchasable from the shop
      Parameters:
      purchasable - The purchase being made
      Throws:
      Shop.NotInStockException - If the item does not exist
      Shop.InsufficientFundsException - If the current gold is not enough to make the purchase
      Trainer.PartyFullException - if the current party if full
